content: ऋतुः [ऋ-तु-किच्च <ls>Uṇ. 1. 71</ls>] {@--1@} A season, period of the year, commonly reckoned to be six; शिशिरश्च वसंतश्च ग्रीष्मो वर्षाः शरद्धिमः; sometimes only five; शिशिर and हिम or हेमंत being counted together; <ab>cf.</ab> पंचर्तवो हेमंतशिशिरयोः समासेन <ls>Ait. Br.</ls> {@--2@} An epoch, a period any fixed or appointed time. {@--3@} Menstruation, courses, menstrual discharge. {@--4@} A period favourable for conception; वरमृतुषु नैवाभिगमनं <ls>Pt. 1</ls>; ऋतुः स्वाभाविकः स्त्रीणां रात्रयः षोडश स्मृताः <ls>Ms. 3. 46</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">9. 70</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 11</ls>, <ls n="Y. 1.">79.</ls> {@--5@} Any fit season or right time. {@--6@} Fixed order or rule. {@--7@} Light, splendour. {@--8@} A month. {@--9@} <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu. {@--10@} A symbolical expression for the number ‘six.’ {@--11@} A kind of collyrium.
